result.execSummary:
The defendant Hector Rafael Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Hector Rafael Rodriguez was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Hector Rafael Rodriguez is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Hector Rafael Rodriguez was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Court Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Court Trial

supervisions.notes:
-  Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero).
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate (to be determined by the Dept of Corrections) of prison funds.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with 486  days credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
-  No Contact Order with the victim during the term of initial confinement.  State requests after initial confinement any contact be at the agent's discretion.  After the initial confinement, the victim will be an adult and the court declines to order further no contact.
-  No unsupervised contact with any children under the age of 16 with the exception of defendant's biological child(ren).

-  Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment/therapy.
-  Take all medications as prescribed.
-  Successfully complete a Sex Offender treatment program.
-  Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking/Behavior Modification program.
-  Comply with Sex Offender Registry requirements.
-  Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so).

-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
-  Absolute Sobriety.
-  Random screens.

supervisions.notes: COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hector Rafael Rodriguez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Hector Rafael Rodriguez in court with Attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Defendant Hector Rafael Rodriguez in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds.  PSI reviewed by the parties; State notes that defendant's federal conviction(s) are omitted.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor and he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

As to Count 2:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  14 years, consecutive to any other sentence, with 486  days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  4  years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  10 years.  

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Absolute Sobriety
-  Random screens
-  Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment/therapy
-  Take all medications as prescribed
-  Minimum of part-time employment
-  Successfully complete a Sex Offender treatment program
-  Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking/Behavior Modification program
-  Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
-  No Contact Order with the victim during the term of initial confinement.  State requests after initial confinement any contact be at the agent's discretion.  After the initial confinement, the victim will be an adult and the court declines to order further no contact.
-  No unsupervised contact with any children under the age of 16 with the exception of defendant's biological child(ren).
-  Comply with Sex Offender Registry requirements
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate (to be determined by the Dept of Corrections) of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
Clerk:  jms
from Carmen B. dated 10/2/16, received and filed.
Letters in support of defendant.

Defendant Hector Rafael Rodriguez in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle (by phone).  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he cannot vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.   Defendant also advised because he has been convicted of a violent felony under Section 941.29, if he possesses a firearm within 5 years of completing this felony sentence, he will be subject to a mandatory 3 year initial confinement sentence. Court advised the defendant that he is subject to the sex offender registry and must comply with the sex offender reporting requirements; he was also advised that they cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires them to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age. Court ordered a Presentence Investigation Report at the State's request without a recommendation. This court received approval from the Chief Judge to keep this case for sentencing. Case calendared for SENTENCING in Branch 15 and will be held in Judge Sanders courtroom, room 620 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Hector Rafael Rodriguez in court with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.  Defendant Hector Rafael Rodriguez in custody.  
Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense reports that the defendant refuses to communicate with him at this point.  Statement (hostile) made by defendant.  Colloquy held between the Court and defendant.  Defendant requests new counsel.  Defense counsel feels that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Based upon defendant' motion, defense counsel allowed to withdraw from this matter.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel before Branch 15.
